a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: How does extreme poverty compare to multidimensional
Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and living standards indicators.
Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $1.90 per day.
Data source: World Bank PIP; Alkire, Kanagaratnam and Suppa (2022)
Note: Extreme poverty data is expressed in 2011 international-$. Following an update, World Bank PIP now uses 2017 international-$
for its poverty and inequality data available here.
